Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2021
column13: Vine Customer Review of Free Product
column14: I was really excited to use this device seeing that it gives you Android 9 in your car and all you have to do is own a vehicle with wired CarPlay to use it! The setup was really easy just plug it into your CarPlay USB, connect to it via Bluetooth, and youâ€™re all set. You donâ€™t need a 2018+ car, as I did it with a 2017 and it worked fine! Onto the device features, it very much is android 9 down to the core with a skin on top. Most apps will run pretty smoothly like YouTube and Hulu for instance but Iâ€™ve noticed that Google Maps is incredibly slow and I usually have to force close it to the point where I ended up going back to CarPlay in general as it was just taking too long to load map data. Thereâ€™s split screen which is super useful though if you want to rock Google chrome and Netflix or YouTube. The browsers run fine, not too slow and not too quick. I think for the asking price the devices should be able to get a cpu or ram buff to handle more demanding tasks like maps as it really shouldnâ€™t take that long but in general this device is pretty solid for everything else! Itâ€™s cool to have a fully functional version of android in your car!

column6: Cheap price, premium features. VERY good for this price!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2019
column14: At $30 this dash cam is surprisingly good. The features like G-Sensor, wide dynamic range and night vision are really impressive at this price. And to boot, I'm very impressed with the picture quality. It came with a good long cable which will be easy to tuck around the edge of the window to hide it away. It starts recording immediately when the car is started, and the "parking mode" is neat (to automatically start recording when it sees movement while the car is parked). See my video for the full review with sample footage (daytime).

column6: Wish I had this years ago!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2021
column14: This thing is fantastic! I already got a guy blasting by me on the right hand side on an illegal pass, running a stop sign, improper passing, and all of that allowed me to get his license plate on video so that the cops could run it later on and find out it was canceled. Speaking of cops, I have one of those guys on video making an illegal pass in a no passing zone with no emergency lights activatedâ€¦ This thing is hysterical fun! The amazing amount of weird stuff that you catch people doing on video is unbelievable. The video is really excellent here, and the audio from the camera picks up whatever you say on the spur of the moment, so just watch yourself when you start seeing strange stuff. ðŸ¤£

column6: Camera doesn't stay in the mount
column9: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2021
column14: Camera works well, however I have an issue that the roads in my country have many holes and bumps, and every 3 to 4 days the camera suddenly falls off from the suction mount and I have to put it in place again in the next stop light. The mount should be a bit more adjusted, or have some of those spring ball locks to hold it in place.

column6: Paid $20 used worked but still returned

column14: Too complicated I had few great cams many more junkers. This worked but when I get dash cam I want only a few things. Longevity, simplicity, and great price. Plug in, record, dont burnout, and don't make me have to read a instructions booklet so the memory card doesn't fill up an ho to turn screen off but still record. I'm sure if you had time to waste on. Dashcam it be fine not for me

column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2021
column14: Price is reasonable. The suction isn't all that great it does fall off my windshield after awhile. Picture quality is solid. It does need to be plugged in while you are driving. It makes my car feel a bit cluttered.Only 1 camera lens.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2021
column14: Fantastic value from a product that I paid ~$22 for! It came with two mounts, a power cable for the car, a USB cable for transferring data, and a 16 page manual with instructions that are actually understandable!

column6: Pretty good, but cigarette plug is delicate.
column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2021
column14: The camera is pretty good, sometimes it slips off the mount...the cigarette plug that you plug in to get power is sort of delicate, it may be the wire that comes from the back and after you use the plug several times the wire may loosen or crack and the power is interrupted. Maybe some black electrical tape put on before it goes bad may help the wire from moving too much.
